title: Understanding New York State Mathematics Test Questions
driving_question: How can we interpret and answer the different types of questions in the New York State Mathematics Test?
short_background_context: The New York State Education Department administers Mathematics Tests annually, releasing a significant portion of the questions for review and use. These questions are designed to assess the New York State P–12 Learning Standards for Mathematics, including multiple-choice, short-response, and extended-response questions. Multiple-choice questions assess standard algorithms and conceptual standards, often within real-world applications or requiring multiple steps. Short-response questions require students to complete tasks and show their work, often involving multiple steps, multiple mathematics skills, and real-world applications. Extended-response questions ask students to show their work in completing two or more tasks or a more extensive problem, assessing mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application.
tasks: Analyze a set of multiple-choice questions from the New York State Mathematics Test and identify the mathematical concepts being tested in each question.
Select a short-response question from the New York State Mathematics Test and demonstrate how you would answer it, showing all your work.
Choose an extended-response question from the New York State Mathematics Test and complete it, showing your understanding of mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application.
pre_thinking_prompts: What types of mathematical concepts do you think are commonly tested in these exams?
How would you approach a multi-step problem in a test situation?
What strategies do you use to ensure you fully understand a question before attempting to answer it?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your experience answering these test questions. What strategies worked well for you? What areas do you think you need to improve on?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose that approach to solve the problem?
What other methods could you have used to solve this problem?
Why is it important to show all your work when answering these types of questions?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by creating their own multiple-choice, short-response, and extended-response questions, ensuring they align with the New York State P–12 Learning Standards for Mathematics.
